item.description:
The Boston Tea Party - (the one about taxation without representation.)



  • We'll pick up our Will Call tickets
  • gather near the Coffee Bar at Borders across the street at 4:30
  • then, as a group, join the immense line forming in front of the Old South Meeting House
  • doors open at 5pm



Click the teapot to buy tickets.




Doors open at 5:00 pm for this General Admission performance. People are handed out paragraphs to read, either supporting the Patriots or Tories, discussing the stamp tax and tea taxes. Lots of elementary school kids trying to read the words aloud. It's a hoot!


From Brown Paper Tickets email:
Notice for The 237th Anniversary Boston Tea Party Annual Reenactment:

Thank you for purchasing tickets to join us for the 237th Anniversary Boston Tea Party Annual Reenactment! All purchased tickets will be available at the Will Call desk in advance of the program.

You may pick up your tickets during museum hours from 10 am to 4 pm daily or on the day of the Reenactment until 5:00 pm.

We recommend that you arrive early to ensure access to the event. We cannot guarantee admittance for will-call tickets picked up later than 5:00 pm.

Souvenirs are available at the event. Restrooms are available and the Museum is comfortably heated.

If you have any questions, please call (617) 482-6439 or email info@osmh.org.


>>> Old South Meeting House site<<<

Boston Tea Party Reenactment- Tickets on Sale Now

Old South Meeting House presents The 237th Anniversary Boston Tea Party Annual Reenactment

Sunday, December 12, 2009, at 5:30 pm at Old South Meeting House

Be part of history at the meeting that protested a tax and started a revolution. Join in with Samuel Adams, Paul Revere and throngs of colonists resolved to send the tea ships back to England!

Then witness the destruction of the tea as you are transported back in time to Boston Harbor on that moonlit night of December 16, 1773.

The Boston Tea Party ended in Boston Harbor, but it all started here! Old South Meeting Houseâ€” steeped in history!

Space is very limited and this event may sell out. Purchase your tickets early to avoid disappointment".
item.name: 237th Anniversary Boston Tea Party Annual Reenactment @ Old South Meeting House
